channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump administration asks the Supreme Court to restore ‘DOGE’ access to Social Security data
item.description: Solicitor General Sauer says the existing restrictions harm urgent federal priorities

item.title: OPEC+ crashed oil prices by hiking output in April. Here’s why it could do that again.
item.description: OPEC+ will now meet Saturday — instead of Monday, as previously planned — according to news reports.

item.title: My father is giving me $250K to buy a home, but told me not to tell my two siblings. Am I morally obligated to tell them?
item.description: “I don’t want to jeopardize my father’s kind offer.”

item.title: ‘Retirement is within my grasp’: I’m 57, my 401(k) is dropping and I’m feeling anxious about a recession. What can I do?
item.description: “I feel like I’m fiddling while Wall Street burns.”

item.title: My sister has a learning disability and her husband squandered $100,000. How do I protect her after I’m gone?
item.description: “She always worked part-time in a grocery store or at stock-clerk jobs until COVID. He does Instacart and similar deliveries for work.”

item.title: Charts indicate what may happen next in long-running Coke-Pepsi stock battle, says Carter Worth
item.description: The chart analyst breaks down Pepsi vs. Coca-Cola going back as far as 40 years.

item.title: Berkshire meeting 'bazaar' features Buffett Squishmallows, 60th anniversary book and giant claw machine
item.description: The conglomerate's yearly convention kicked off Friday with a shareholder-only shopping event, called the "Berkshire Bazaar of Bargains."

item.title: These are Morningstar's top-rated dividend ETFs in 2025
item.description: Investors seeking income have several high-quality options in dividend-paying exchange-traded funds, according to Morningstar.

item.title: Wall Street loves this under-the-radar Nvidia derivative play
item.description: Shares have held steady so far this year, rising about 1%, while Nvidia stock has lost about 15%.

item.title: Ariel’s John Rogers says he’s been buying steadily throughout this downturn. What he’s buying
item.description: Rogers said his firm has added to its positions in entertainment stocks and a beaten-down cruise operator.
